Bees are just too big currently.

It's like they are a cubic meter of insect guts.

I would be happy for bees to be the size of bats or silverfish.

Even reducing bee size by 20% would be OK.
This is cool but maybe it could be a very rare spawn and have some sort of expensive counter spell/potion.
Or should they take damage?
actually a good idea
i don't think it wants to be friends...

I must say that this Is a pretty Interesting Idea, however, creepers pretty much exist to explode and grief the player.

If anything, there should be a new plant mob of sorts. Creepers are green, so they're likely sentient cacti with tnt Infused. Perhaps there should be an adorable sentient tree stump (probably called the rootie) that fling small roots around or jumping to crush their target.

They should be tamed with bone meal and have 15 HP, and can come In all forms of wood, Including birch, dark oak, an acecia.

add the adoptable creeper pls, Microsoft.
have a idea
for make the creeper pet you need one of tnt but normal tnt
What about some creepers that have any sniffers as pets and trade you stuff
he piglins is humans mixed with pigs in the nether so they have water bottles on them when they go to the nether
Then you also propose to remove the iron nugs and boots

The piglins get the iron nuggets from chests in bastion remnants. They also get ingots in both bastions and nether fortresses. The two structures were most likely not built by them {in the lore of the game}. They may have learned how to make potions and other materials from an ancient civilization that was in the nether before the player character. They probably took their stuff from the fortress and bastions when they disappeared and claimed the bastions for themselves. The four bartering items that don't make sense are the both types of fire resistance potions since there is no way to get glass in the nether to make the bottles, the water bottles because of the glass and water, and the enchanted book since you can't get paper in the nether to make the book. Plus a water bottle isn't really worth a gold ingot anyway.
I think it makes sense that they are keeping a liquid unknown to the piglins in bottles for safe keeping, sort of how we save moon rocks and stuff.
maby the reason for portal ruins and zombified piglins is because they went to the overworld
I'M SO GLAD SOMEONE ELSE NOTICED

They would be neutral. If you hunted a group of walrus in a boat on the ocean and you harmed one, it would turn around from fleeing from you and charge your boat dealing you damage. If it rammed your boat three times with its tusks, your boat would break and you wouldn't be able to get it back! They would also attack you if you are near their babies, or if you harm them on land. They would be much slower on land, and can be found in hoards along beaches relaxing in the sun. If killed, they could drop ivory and blubber.

I felt like this post needed more info. I had an idea like this but it never got put on here. I vote.
what would they drop on death?
They would drop ivory and blubber, benjamen.
how else can the tusk be occupied?

There's a skeleton necromancer already In Minecraft dungeons. If there'd be an Illager counterpart, It'd be called the Practicer, As they practice the dark arts. 

 

 

Further more, I had the Idea of an orb of the night, which comes from their staff when slain. We can fuse It with an empty tome to get the tome of the moon, which functions like this staff.. But Instead of limited durability, we could have a mana bar that drains when using magic and fills back up over time. This would start a new tome and totem system, where totems are more passive while tomes tend to be for aggressive spells.

I like the idea of it being faster than a boat, plus maybe being able to go underwater, with the trade-off being you can't carry other things or take it out of water like a boat, plus since it's a mob you'd need to tame it.
Love this idea, you could have a seahorse egg. You could tame and ride with seaweed on a stick

the cage texture can be used from minecraft: dungeons. crafting: iron bars, iron ingots and iron pressure plate. in the set trap, you must put carrots (for a rabbit), fish (for a cat), seeds (for a chicken or a parrot), sweet berries (for a fox) or kelp (for turtles). after the mob eats the bait, the cage will close. a cage block is mined with an iron pickaxe or better. if you get a cage with a mob inside without a silk touch, the cage itself will get, and the mob will run away.
I like this idea. The cages would be useful for transporting pets and stop them from being harmed.
And not in the. Nether
Agreed but maybe the wither can summon it
Great idea!
That would be funny XD Just enderman are known as a threat most of the time so I don't think having them as pets would fit the game.
Very nice with using more of those tags of that. I never knew about Orlando Bloom but it is just like a cat and creeper
Great idea. I'm also wondering what would happen if you named a Pig, Orlando or Bloom. Also, maybe naming one Orlando Bloom would also cause it.
HA, HA, HA, HA, HA!! Very funny. cool idea. I did not know Orlando Bloom was scared of pigs.
Bruh. Adding an entire new cat type just for fishing no just no. make 10% of any cat breed go fishing. not adding a new mob called fishing cats! Why though!
They are endangered, and absolutely adorable, so I see this as a perfect opportunity for Mojang to add them to the game and raise awareness for these beautiful little kitties!

hey i just wanted to point out that the mooshler dont have to be hostile they could also be passive if you want because some peolpe say that the mushroom island was a peaceful island for a long time and changing that wouldnt be that good

i still think that making them hostile wouldnt be that bad but if the people want them to be peaceful then mojang studios might just do that instead

ps : im writing this as a comment because i dont want my post to be in the pending approval stage again. it takes forever for posts to be accepted.  if you want the mooshler to be passive then just write a comment about it.
Good idea but why does it have moo- on it. It looks NOTHING like a cow.
Its called mooshler because they protect the mooshroom
How do you tame them? Great idea by the way.
You use blaze powder to tame them. Eye of enders to make them neutral. Ender Pearls to make them hostile.
Bruh I lost all my fully enchanted netherite gear bc the dumb effect lasts 9 years
I disagree, the wither being challenging is what makes it a good boss fight and really fits what the wither actaully does, mindless destruction.
skill issue
So it's basically a Lava Serpent?
Maybe they will walk a bit slower then walking on lava tho
I like this idea. Was hoping magma could keep them happy in my stables without killing me going in there
Yes! Red Strider on magma block!
Yes, and it should keep them from shivering. Having a pet strider is nice but it shouldn’t have to take lava if you want to make them look happier.
True i dont know why they dont
They don't even have to go as fast in my opinion. I just don't want to fall in lava but i can't stand seeing them cold :(

The magma blocks would be a nice middle ground. Dismounting a strider has a risk of falling in lava. This change would make striders more appealing while slightly adding a buff for Frost Walker. And most importantly, why would I want to abuse my strider via freezing it, just to be able to dismount safely.
I think they should not be as fast as on lava but faster than on ground, and they should warm up and not shiver, so you can build strider stables without need for lava buckets
These effects could also be spread faster when the wither's skull projectile lands.

Maybe the Grass around the Wither gets some Special Version of Soul Sand that looks black-witherstyle? And if one of his shots miss, the Explosion would cause a bit Netherack and Fire? Or spawn a Wither Skelleton?aybe they could add Wither Archers too Minecraft?
(Have too much Ideas)
I like that
It should be very rare.

Considering this is quite literally the world's rarest animal, I'd love it if there was only around 10 of these on a map (could be changed in config if the player wants to find more/less of them tho), and the player would get a benefit for finding them. Perhaps if they were to be fed fish they could give the player experience points and a few items, they would only be able to give the bonus once. If the player can unite two Baiji they will eventually produce a baby (no breeding required, they do it on their own, but they only do it if there's no other baby Baiji around.) and the player will be rewarded an achievement called "Preserving the Species", which comes alongside a hefty experience bonus.

Having this animal in the game would bring so many bonuses, you get to add the world's rarest animal, increase the biodiversity in rivers (which sorely need something interesting), increase the number of Asian animal species in the game (which is a bit lacking IMO, especially considering the diversity of the continent), and you get more aquatic animals, which we can always do with.
it's an extinct species so it could be very rare. Since it's very rare when you found and swim with it you should get the very special effect from it.

They should be like turtle eggs, an innocent creature to protect... (especially from its psychopathic, racist, capitalist, attention hogging, drunkard relatives that actively support the finning of innocent sharks, and in case you are wondering I meant dolphins, and yes all of those descriptions are accurate. slightly biased, maybe, but accurate.) Dolphins would attack them, drowned would attack them, and so on, and they would need to be protected so they could give you a reward such as permanent Dolphin's Grace or something like that.
Not only pet armor though. It would need to drop materials which can be crafted for you, or pets. In a new structure perhaps? Different name needed, otherwise 100% love this.

Phantoms are even more annoying than ghasts, and doing this removes the unique potential this biome holds for mob farms. In addition, phantoms aren't particularly nether-y mobs.

Phantoms would fit perfectly with the ghosts and bones theme of the Soul Sand Valleys, as well as upping the challenge of surviving the nether, especially since there’s no sunlight to save you this time.
They should add it there but it should also have another deterrent like maybe glow stone and shroom lights which would scare it away cause they look like the sun it.
All I know is Crimson/Warped Fungi should be renewable like any tree, any plant or any mushroom.
what if you have to hit the cow with a weakness potion first than any normal mushroom (red brown crimson warped ) would transform it into the respective mooshroom when fed to it

Maybe a rare hoglin with fungi, with a crimson and warped hoglin variant per the biomes. These make it renewable by not just dropping 2-5 when they are killed, but by spreading 3-10 around them when bred with a 50-75 percent chance of spreading per breed.

A jungle is a warm biome, though :|

Don't know about blazes, but you could have fire tornadoes burn through the savanna biome, as tornadoes have been talked about as plains exclusive, and savannas are similar, but they are warm biomes.
Maybe these could spawn in the soul fields of the Nether?
